comment.text: This translation key is used to display a success message when copying a folder. The message includes the original folder name and the destination folder's name. It appears as a toast notification in the UI.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The order of the placeholders <1> and <2> is reversed in the Azerbaijani translation compared to the English content. The English version places <2> before <1>, while the Azerbaijani version places <1> before <2>.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Reorder the placeholders to match the English original: `<1>{{folderName}}</1> <2>{{title}}</2> qovluğu uğurla kopyalandı

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The preposition ':n' at the end of the sentence is grammatically incorrect. It appears to be an attempt at indicating possession or location, but it's not appropriate in this context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove ':n' from the end of the sentence.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Japanese translation maintains the original XML formatting tags <2>{{title}}</2> and <1>{{folderName}}</1>. While technically correct, these tags are unusual and may be unnecessary in the final displayed text. Consider removing them or adapting them for Japanese conventions if applicable.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Evaluate whether the XML tags are needed in the Japanese context. If not, remove them. If they are necessary, ensure they are appropriate for the target system's parsing rules.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Korean translation maintains the same HTML tag order (<2> before <1>) as the English source, which might not be the intended visual order in the user interface. Consider reversing the order of the variables in the Korean translation to match the logical flow or UI expectation.

The English phrase 'successfully copied' is not accurately reflected in the Lao translation. 'ຢ່າງສໍາເລັດແລ້ວ' literally translates to 'already' or 'completed,' implying a process that's already finished, but not necessarily a successful copy. A better translation would convey the successful nature of the action.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ໄຟລ໌ <2>{{title}}</2> ຖືກສໍາເນົາສູ່ <1>{{folderName}}</1> ຢ່າງຖືກຕ້ອງ

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'successfully copied' is better translated as 'succesvol gekopieerd' in Dutch. 'Met succes gekopieerd' is grammatically correct but sounds slightly less natural.

The order of the placeholders <1> and <2> is reversed compared to the English version. In the English version, <2> represents 'title' and <1> represents 'folderName'. In the Polish translation, <2> represents 'title' but <1> represents 'folderName'. This reversal could lead to incorrect display in the UI.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Change the Polish translation to: "Pomyślnie skopiowano katalog <1>{{title}}</1> do katalogu <2>{{folderName}}</2>"

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Sinhala translation retains the English tag structure `<2>{{title}}</2>` and `<1>{{folderName}}</1>`. This is unnecessary and should be removed for a natural Sinhala rendering.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the tags.  The content should be integrated naturally into the sentence.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While not incorrect, 'සාර්ථකව' (saarthakava) is a fairly formal way to say 'successfully.' Consider a more colloquial alternative for better flow depending on the intended audience.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using a more colloquial equivalent for 'සාර්ථකව', such as 'සහෝදරත්වයෙන්' (sahodarathvayaen) or something similar, based on context.  However, 'සාර්ථකව' is not inherently wrong.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'folder' is transliterated as 'Фолдер' instead of translated as 'Мапка'. While understandable, 'Мапка' would be more natural in Serbian.

The original English content uses angle brackets around variables. The Turkish translation also uses angle brackets. While not strictly incorrect, it's worth ensuring this format is consistent with the application's overall style guide and that it's actually *needed* for the translated output. It may be preferable to remove them, depending on the target application's rendering needs.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider removing the angle brackets `<2>` and `</2>` and `<1>` and `</1>` if the application doesn't require them.
